reviews.text: We loved it - the dishes are beautifully prepared and with a high attention to detail. The view is spectacular and the service on point. Starters were pricey, so we skipped. Overall, highly recommended!

Highly satisfied with the food, service, and evening dining at Peron! Everything from the appetizer (loved the blinis and fish egg pate!) to dessert was amazing. All the seafood was very very fresh, and well seasoned. Great open space with amazing balcony view of sunset to add! The staff was very kind, attentive, and made us feel relaxed. Definitely a memorable treat in Marseille.

We found this restaurant on the Michelin Guide. It is a fine seafood dining experience with beautiful views of the water. It is expensive, but nothing unexpected for a place of this caliber. We particularly enjoyed the catch of the day which was a 3.6 kg sea bass that they split among 6 of us. They even brought the fish out before cooking it to let us inspect it (it was a good looking fish but I’m not going to pretend I knew what to look for!).

Peron came highly recommended and it didn’t disappoint. From the friendly greeting by the hostess to the excellent suggestions for wine pairings by our waiter. The service was impeccable. We loved our dining alcove on the 2nd floor (very quiet) and the pacing of the food service was relaxed.
They were able to accommodate my husband’s gluten allergy (celiac) with many menu options.
The bouillabaisse was the highlight as well as the Fresh fish of the day (John Dory). The swordfish plate and the monkfish dish were also delicious!
Peron was a dining highlight while in Marseille!

Very sophisticated cuisine I should say. They serve high class cuisines where the staff explains the deep details. The foods are very tasty.

Very friendly staff, nice ambience with open sea view, clean and modern interior design.

There is no parking space, suggested to use taxi or car with driver, other that by walk.
